Query: We’re a family of four visiting Singapore for 3 days. We’d love to explore kid-friendly attractions and try some affordable local food. Budget is around 300 SGD.

Hawker.Description: A classic Singaporean dish featuring tender poached chicken and fragrant rice cooked in chicken stock, served with chili sauce and ginger paste.
A spicy noodle soup with a rich coconut milk base, featuring rice noodles, prawns, and cockles, topped with laksa leaves.
A stir-fried noodle dish with flat rice noodles, prawns, Chinese sausage, and cockles, cooked with a smoky 'wok hei' flavor.
A South Indian flatbread that is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, often served with a side of curry.
A famous Singaporean seafood dish featuring crabs cooked in a sweet, savory, and spicy tomato-based sauce.

Attraction.Description: KidZania Singapore is an interactive indoor theme park that allows children to role-play various professions in a kid-sized city. It's perfect for families with children who enjoy imaginative play and learning through fun activities.

The Singapore Zoo is renowned for its 'open' design, where animals are kept in spacious, landscaped enclosures separated from visitors by moats and glass. It's a great place for families to explore and learn about wildlife.

River Wonders is Asia's first and only river-themed wildlife park, featuring animals from various river habitats. It's an educational and fun experience for families interested in nature and wildlife.

The S.E.A. Aquarium is one of the world's largest aquariums, home to more than 100,000 marine animals. It's a fascinating place for families to explore the underwater world and learn about marine life.

The Museum of Ice Cream offers a whimsical experience with interactive exhibits and unlimited ice cream treats. It's a delightful place for families with children who love ice cream and playful environments.
